page.title: 10HOUSING IN MARSKE AND AREA.
page.content: All housing is of stone construction using Millstone and Limestone Grit from local quarries. Farmhouses and cottages built in 18th and 19th centuries have roofs of stone slates and sash windows. The interiors are modernised. Houses added this century are conversions or extensions of existing buildings. Also there has been some infilling. New units are faced with stone, have concrete slates and casements windows. Owner occupation is general apart from nine flats at Marske Hall, rented from an owner living outside the area. About six holiday cottages are let on a weekly or monthly basis. Size of houses varies from the former Rectory with 6 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms , to 2 bedroomed cottages with 1 bathroom. All have well cultivated gardens. There is mains water and septic tanks
